content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma (subpleural right upper lobe primary)

Management:	2023 Nov - Stereotactic radiosurgery to solitary right parietal brain metastasis
		2023 Dec - Commenced Sotorasib 960mg daily

Histology:	KRAS G12C mutant adenocarcinoma with STK11 co-mutation

Current Situation:	Cycle 4 review Sotorasib

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the thoracic oncology clinic. She continues to tolerate Sotorasib well with no significant side effects beyond mild fatigue which is manageable. Her cough has completely resolved and she reports feeling generally well with good energy levels. She has been maintaining regular swimming sessions three times weekly.

Her recent MRI brain (March 15th 2024) shows continued response of the treated right parietal metastasis with no new intracranial disease. CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from last week demonstrates stable appearance of the right upper lobe primary lesion measuring 2.8cm (previously 2.9cm) with no new sites of disease.

On examination today, chest is clear with good air entry bilaterally. Neurological examination remains normal with no focal deficits.

The plan is to continue with Sotorasib at full dose with routine blood monitoring. We will arrange repeat CT and MRI brain in 3 months' time. She will be reviewed back in clinic in 6 weeks with blood results.

cancer_timeline.value: Stereotactic radiosurgery to solitary right parietal brain metastasis
MRI brain shows continued response of the treated right parietal metastasis with no new intracranial disease
CT shows stable right upper lobe primary lesion measuring 2.8cm (previously 2.9cm) with no new sites of disease

patient_facts.value: maintaining regular swimming sessions three times weekly
chest clear with good air entry bilaterally
neurological examination normal with no focal deficits

status_updates.value: Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma with brain metastasis showing stable disease on Sotorasib. Good clinical status with resolved symptoms and maintaining activity.
Stable disease with primary tumor 2.8cm (previously 2.9cm) and continued response of treated brain metastasis
Repeat CT and MRI brain in 3 months
Review in clinic in 6 weeks with blood results
